DataElement.preferredName: Patient Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Stratification Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a condition or state related to process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis based on a type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Stratification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis based on a type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei.:The process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Patient Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Stratification Status
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a condition or state at a particular time of Fluorescence in situ Hybridization as related to patient's stratification.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain.

Concepts.definition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is almost certain.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is small.

Concepts.definition: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action or attribute or condition is small.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueDomain.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.description: Indicate the level/status that was determined centrally and reported to you.
